data.text:
@FaithfullJohn JESUS JOHN! I thought you went positive for a second and my heart low-key broke. 

Cool info though, thanks :)
@FaithfullJohn @TheNobleGasbag Finally, a geology angle that we were all looking for
@RyanIckert @FaithfullJohn @thermochronic And there are LFTs for elemental detection too (e.g. https://t.co/jvJmGhK2or). Now if someone could make the reactions isotope specific...

@RyanIckert @FaithfullJohn @thermochronic The amazing thing I took from that paper is all of the 'ingredients' were off-the-shelf for that industry. You could, in theory, order the reagents and make your own LFT...
@FaithfullJohn Europium has always been one of my favorite elements!
@FaithfullJohn @thermochronic Thanks for sharing this.  I'd wondered about the details!
@RyanIckert @thermochronic Not sure. Lots of the medical refs on LFTs do refer to "lanthanide-doped" though ..

@FaithfullJohn @thermochronic Any idea which specific test this applies to?  Or is it all of them?  I have no idea how the pharmacutical industry works. (I'm thinking you might know because of how you came across the ms)
@FaithfullJohn REEs are clever little things. I like them.
